metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5189 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome prior to 54.0.2840.59 for Windows, Mac, and Linux;54.0.2840.85 for Android permitted navigation to blob URLs withnon-canonical origins, which allowed a remote attacker to spoof thecontents of the Omnibox (URL bar) via crafted HTML pages.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5189` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
